messages.content: There is no such thing as a bad hair day.
What is the origin of the phrase "How razorback-jumping frogs can level six piqued gymnasts"?

The phrase "How razorback-jumping frogs can level six piqued gymnasts" is derived from a 19th century song by the British singer Frank Sinatra. The phrase is often used to jokingly question the strength and ability of frogs, as mentioned in the song. The phrase is meant to be a humorous and playful joke, but it is not a true statement of fact.
